body.p:
Munfordville Saturday
May 25th 1861
To/
His Excellency B. Maggoffin
Governor of Kentucky of Ky
My friend,

I see from the papers of yesterday that the Military Bill has passed, that your excellency other gentlemen & myself compose the board. Supposing that it is desirable to have a meeting of the board at the earliest day practicable, I write to say that I will go to Frankfort any day you may suggest as suitable for the board to hold its first meeting. I have not been informed, but do not permit myself to doubt, about the Banks furnishing us with the money. Advise me immediately when to that ^I shall^ be at Frankfort.

I am Respectfully
G. T. Wood

Sec will answer Col Wood -- B. M
